title: Implausible nonsense
review: What do you get when you cross Gandhi, Nelson Mandela and a low budget Tarantino effort? This. As for the Hasidic Jews, they look about as Jewish as Bugs Bunny.

movie_title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
title: Low art and cheap thrills
review: Considering the budget and talent available, a disapointment.

title: The real horror is the grain of authenticity
review: Whilst the imagery is disturbing the real horror is the concept, because the plot actually contains grains of authenticity. Idolatry from Molach down to Nazism involved unspeakable cruelty and human sacrifice. Modern cults likewise exploit ignorant and vulnerable people searching for spirituality through drugs and indoctrination.

title: Rare masterpiece
review: Powerful and relevant but not always easy to watch.

title: Impressive budget and cast but too long
review: After the first hour I grew, well frankly bored. Daniel Day Lewis, some admittedly good scenes and a fabulous historical New York set are insufficient to rescue an overly protracted drama that is too long and self indulgent.
